reviewText:
Well this game is pretty much a simpler football manager.

Pros:
-Ratings for player is really simple, simple enough for most people to understand the game.
-It has most of the players and the popular teams.
-If you've played soccer manager before in their website, this is mostly the same game as that.
-There's a single player and a multiplayer experience.
-You can (slowly, depending on how much you win) earn points to earn SM credit. (SM credit is what you can buy with real money to help you in the game)
-Best of all this game is free to play.

Cons:
-The developers took steps back in the development of the game like how you can't make customs formations anymore and that player info pages doesn't open a pop-up menu.
-Confusing login screen.
-Needs some cool music.

reviewText:
For someone who is used to play free soccer/football management games this is one is quite outstanding but needs some proper fixes.

Reasons to play
*For a free game this one isn't filled with ads to buy coins/credits/whatever. Ofcourse they ask for it from time to time but it isn't annoying at all.
*The structure of the game is simple and you can see this as a pro. After a time you know exactly what you're doing and how to behave.
*it has real clubs and leagues. CL and EL too.

Reasons to stay away
*As I said before it needs to fix the bugs etc. For example: It doesn't matter how many players you have on your loan list,    clubs don't ask for them at all. This can effect your game experience and fun.
*After a time it can be boring watching how you've just won the league. Seeing a window with: You've won the league! Hooray. And then there's the new season, just like a year ago. (Maybe this is just me being a bit grumpy)
*The only sound to hear from this game is the sound of cheering for a goal. This can't be difficult to change, can it?

reviewText:
I'm sorry to say this. 2015 was an awesome game, but this has one really annoying glitch while playing the game. An alarming amount of own goals that were supposed to be backpasses or just dribbled into the back of the net and indirect goals (ones intended to be balls in). If this was just every now and again, it wouldn't be too annoying but I haven't conceded any goals that aren't like this other than afew corners. Fix this, and I'll love this series of games again.

Edit : Yep. Still happening. And another thing also happens now. Defenders pass it around at the back, then give it away. Lost 0-8 at home to Tottenham as Swansea. 2 own goals, 1 indirect goal, one normal one and 4 ones due to passing it around at the back. This game is broken and desperately needs an update. Annoyingly, the app isn't affected by these problems, which means the developers are perfectly capable of making a great game and clearly don't feel the need to give the pc version any attention.

Edit 2: When I realised there was an update, i got really hopeful that this broken game might have finally got fixed. Then in all my pre-season friendlies I conceded at least 1 own goal. PLEASE FIX THIS GAME.

reviewText:
As someone who is really bored of waiting for Football Manager 16, I decided to get this game, I enjoyed it but it felt more arcade-y then realistic, randomly, your team's form can just change in one match, the economy in this game is quite random with absurd prices, the ratings system is quite weird as well. Despite that, I enjoyed winning a goal and it had the fun of playing a football management game,

It could've been better though with more detail but for some reason, contracts go forever, which is good, but for someone who is managing Peterborough United, it's quite expensive.

7/10
If you're bored of waiting for FM16, play this for a while.

reviewText:
i would like to start with a big well done to the creators of this game  for a free game i have clocked u many hours  on it and i am completely ingrosed by the game.

there are a few things i would like to change but they are just my own opinions that i would like to have in the game, first i would like to have more control over the formations i do not feel that there is enough formation choices or the ability to create you`re own formation, i feel it would give ypu abit more envolvement in the game.
Secondly i would for more options when it comes to transfers and loaning of players, i feel that ypu should be able to trade players in a sale and buy players then loan them back to the club it would make the transfer market that bit more realistic.

aswell as that i would have also liked the ability to change the stadium design as well as getting investments and sponsors, and my final thing would be to have more envolvement in dealing and managering players and how they develope such as how they train having meetings with them and a bigger choice in how they train.

i love this game and the things i have mentioned are the things that i personally would like to see in the game , on a hole this game is good for people that like manager games and i think that you will get plenty of enjoyment

reviewText:
Product received for free

As a free game, its a great download. Its really fun if you just wanna pass some time or you're really bored. It would be great if they keep it a free-to-play but i wont mind paying a small sum for a more complete game which is more realistic..thats what they gotta do if they wanna compete with Football Manager. So, here are cons which could prove to be helpful in developing the SM17 game hopefully:
- Unrealistic ratings. Most average players are 85+ rated and this is too unrealistic..developers should give more effort to giving ratings similar to Fifa, cuz thats the only football game out there with realistic ratings. Players like Sven Bender should not be 91 rated.
- The results are very predictable. There should be more pressure given to managers to think hard and bump up their tactical game.
- Narrow variety of features and customization.
- No option to choose the currency of the in-game money.
- Not enough changes made from SM15.
Once again, I dont mind paying for a game which is a few bucks well spent, FM16 is a great game but overpriced, so if SM17 is going to be around 2,3$ for a better and more complete game, its probably more thoughtful than keeping it as a free-to-play.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game is pretty good. It's a simple way pf managing a wide range of teams. Though if you want an in-depth game this isn't the type for you. You basically buy and sell players and set up your sqaud; you do upgrade facilities and players get injured but it doesn't change much.

There are in game purchases which gives you more money for buying players. That is probably the biggest let down of the entire game so you basically can't buy messi or ronaldo unless you pay money. Which is sneaky.

The scorelines and games are quite realistic unlike your my mate who has 100 shots and wins 31-0 in a friendly they're realistic.

I like the randomness of outcomes you could be in a winning league situation and then keep losing in the last five games and qualify for the Europa League next year.

This game is easy to learn by yourself and can get quite addictive. So overall I would rate the game 8.25/10!

People also say this is unprotective by suspicious looking things though it's really not. Trust me your 100% per cent safe :)

reviewText: For a free game, this is exceptionally good. I am enjoying playing what I feel is a simpler version of Football Manager and it is the simplicity of it that I like. Of course it could be improved by adding more realism to match ratings, matches themselves and player star ratings (outside of matches). Scouting would also be nice to not need credits for but it does not make anything compulsory to pay for which helps boost the games credibility. Overall, I do like this game and I was surprised at the level of quality considering it is a free game. Worth a download for anyone wanting to kill sometime who doesn't want to get into the sort of level FM has to offer.

reviewText:
How can you not loved a free football (or soccer) manager? I played alot of football manager (or soccer) since ps2 era and moved to pc : fifa manager 11 ( which until now and forever will be my only best football manager ) soccer manager 2016  is 10x better than any free football manager that you can find in facebook or anywhere else.

+2D Match view

-Lost my previous SM2015 save because theres no more steam-login required. ( I should have used FB login back in SM2015)
-Still no music

Overall Soccer Manager 2016 is a great game for all football or soccer fans.

reviewText:
(UPDATE) Devs listened to the Community input, and removed the forced login system, so cheers to the community and the devs!

This is simply my first impressions on playing the game. You could say I didn't experience the game enough to give it a proper review, but this is about the time I just said I just couldn't play the game anymore.

PROS:
-It doesn't cost 50$ dollars like Football Manager 2016.

-It's free.

-Almost complete control and managing of your entire team!

-Wide selection of teams to choose from!

Meh.
-It seems to have a Online DRM system where your unable to access to game without logining in first while being online. So if you have awful internet, and/or go offline alot, your gonna have problems with this game. (If you have good internet, and/or are online alot, your perfectly fine, this DRM system does not affect you.)

Cons:
-Game has in-game purchases using real life money...

-No proper tutorial on what everything is, and how to properly manage your team.

-Complex and confusing UI.

-Large learning curve.

-NO MUSIC. Or well, none that I EVER encountered. The only sound I got was from the crowds during a game.

Conclusion:
The game feels like a Mobile Game. A good king of mobile game... If you are into complex managing sim/sport games, get it.

reviewText: Im enjoying this game.  I really enjoyed playing 2015 but this new version has a 2D match engine which brings it to a whole new level.  Loads of leagues and clubs to choose from and the best thing of all is that I can also carry on playing my save game on my mobile as they have also made an App.\n\nGreat stuff and looks like Im about to loose hours of my life in this game.

reviewText:
I apologize in advance for any spelling errors.
TL;DR:

- Crap AI.
- Laughable budget for big clubs
- Unrealistic results
- Bearly any tactics
- $50 FM is worth avoiding this cancer.
+ Free

+ Lots of clubs to manage
+ Easy to uninstall.
+ Don't need a refund.

I tried really hard to get into this. I wanted so hard to like this. But I can't. Here's why. This game has so many major flaws it's unbelievable. I know it's free but this is just autism. Straight up autism. I really wanted to type this because most of the reviews are wy u no use steam itz so eazy nuuuuuub gooooosh ♥♥♥♥ dev ♥♥♥♥ dev ♥♥♥”

- Crap AI: The AI is unbelievable. The goalkeepers are emberasing. I've watched them run the ball into there own net. That's great. Defenders will do it too. Strikers can't get a damn shot on target! How hard is it! I can freaking do it with my fat ♥♥♥ how are they fluffing every shot unless there right in front of the net?The most dangerous shots you have a game is five. Five. Everything else that's "dangerous" is them saying LOOK HOW FAR I CAN SHOOT IT! *fluffs ball* Oh and gotta love the goalkeepr not grabbing the ball that's right ♥♥♥♥ing there. MMMMM LOVE IT!
- Laughable budget- The money you get is just plain wrong. Manage the richest team in the world? Here's ten mil. Players that would fit your club are 50 mil. DOn't like it? Pay for cash injection. Either with real money or grind hardcore for the managing points that take longer and longer to get. Now listen I understand you guys gotta make money I get it I get it. But really? That low? You expect me to with the Champions League with no good substitutes and just pray my players don't get ebola for five months ruining my career. By the waaaay the board wants you to win the leaaaaague. HOW ABOUT A CASH INJECTION????? Heeeeeey the transfer window is open. Kind of hard to get all those world class players with one dollar. HOW ABOUT A CASH INJECTION????? The transfer window is gonna close soon. Maybe you can get all your shortlisted players if YOU GOT A CASH INJECTION!!!!! Transfer window is closed. GET THE CASH INJECTION ANYWAYS!!!!!!!
Unrealistic Results - I'll be top of the table destroying title contenders. Looses 3-0 to a team facing relegation. I know it happens sometimes in real life but not every team I manage will loose to a freaking team gasping for points. How does ♥♥♥♥ing paris loose to Tollouse 4-0?????????? I bet Bayern looses 6-0 to Hamburg right? Logic.
Bearly any tactics - Theres bearly any tactics and some clearly don't work. Got a 1-0 lead over a team who would normally tear you a new ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥? Well let's just go on very defensive that should work. Wait you can't tell them to just hold possesion. Oh your defenders just gave up the ball. Oh hey there scored 4 goals. Mmmmmmkaaaaaaay. Can I tell them to stop trying to go for super long shots? Can I tell them to quit passing it out of bounds? Can I tell my ♥♥♥♥ing world class 50k a week defender to stop passing it right ♥♥♥♥ing to them in front of my net? CAN I? NO! NO I CAN'T!

Now I know I've bin saying a lot of negatives but lets talk some positives

- It's free.

- Theres so many clubs to manage. I never cared for managing a team in Qatar. But knowing it's there fills me with happieness.
- Because it bearly takes up any space I can happily uninstall with no hasle.
- I don't need to refund it.

I want to love this game and because I am an abused wife I will keep playing with this abusive husband hoping that it will one day love me and award me for all my loyalty. But we know it won't. Please avoid the abuse. For all of you saying it's better then paying $50 for FM. If $50 saves me from cancer. Take my wallet."

reviewText:
I've been playing this game for a couple hours, 2 seasons to be noted, since yesterday, and I'm pretty happy about its current situation, especially since it's free.

Although it doesn't have any ads, a *cash injection* is suggested from time to time, becoming a bit annoying in the end, but hey.
The pitch is great, you can change tactics mid game, but it lacks a SKIP button.I think it would be a great addition, because even at 30x speed it takes a while and along with the occassional inj. and the half-time pauses, you can't just go away and be back when it's done.

Moving on, the ratings are a BIT off and the news chapter is lacking much variation.Tbh, might as well say that this game could be much more if the devs would go a bit deeper.

The gameplay is pretty smooth, overall being a nice starting point to the genre, but I did experienced some lag on 3 different occassions, every time after a couple games.

Summary - The free Football Manager 2016.  Very in-depth and realistic.

Overall Rating - 84/100

reviewText:
Shortly after i logged in the game started to downloading some game files. I guess it was the data base. However, there was no progress bar, or info on how big this download was. After 90 minutes i had to turn off my computer and the download was not finnish yet.

I have no idea what the download size is. I have no idea what the download speed is. I have no idea how long this download would take. I have no idea if i have to start the download from the beginning again or if it start where i left off. I don't even have a clue if the download was downloading or if it has bugged out..

But i do know that i can't sit around all day waiting for a download when i don't even know if the game is downloading anything or how long it will take. So i guess i will never find out if this game is good or not. What a crappy way to handle the download of the data base. Why not include that in the original steam download??

reviewText: You can play this game for 1 or 2 seasons, but then it gets really boring. I appreciate a slow game, where you don't have to be in front of the screen all the time, but this game is too slow in a sense that you cannot do anything really. There are only a few functions in this game, definitely not a full game so far. Many things do not make sense, such as shots on goal from my team 15, shots on goal from opponent 2 - my team loses the game 0:2 or 1:2. No matter what I did, it always goes like this. Imagine how the score looks like when the opponent team has 6 or 7 shots on goal...you guessed it. I have read this issue from other players as well. It feels imbalanced and unfair. If you do not fire half of your team (you will still have plenty of players) you will be bankrupt. Do not spend money on this game.

reviewText: I'm trying to reinstall this as it is good when it works.  The first season was fine and the second season was ok.  The third season I started, every game I have an own goal and won zero games.  It was very frustrating.  No way does a team go 12 straight games with at least one own goal.  It's free and can be fun but let's see if I can fix this own goal bug by redownloading it.\n\nI reinstalled the game as I said above and the own goals stopped. However, there are more things that need work such as player contracts. Player contracts seem to go on for ever and never have an end date.  Players never complain about pay as they become more important for the team (increase ratings).  This simulator needs more reality with contract negotiations, maximum contract lengths, etc.... More interaction with single players would be desired. I'll still play it but there are better soccer manager sims out there (you have to pay for them but I do as I like more reality based managing gaming).  Not one player complains, the training system is a little akward with choosing different traits to increase. It might be better to just have the players train without the player selecting the traits they work on and getting more to the contract/player problems instead.

reviewText:
Before taking anything into consideration, one must take into account that there's literally no reason to play this if you can afford to buy Football Manager, as it's better in anything you can think about... except price, of course. This does give Soccer Manager a solid niche as the poor man's football management game, and it does not do bad in that regard.

Now, let's get to the game itself.

Pros:
+ If you ever played FM (Especially up to FM09), you'll be able to navigate quite easily.
+ Extremely lightweight. You could teach Sports Interactive a thing or two in that regard :P
+ Wide league selection. Nothing near FM, of course, but bigger than several not-free football games. *glares at FIFA and PES*
+ The microtransactions are not intrusive at all.

Neutral:
~ I'd take the splash screen out of this version, to be frank. I would simply replace it with some Login with Facebook" option available in every screen
date: but not a dedicated screen for it.\n~ There is no option to create customized formations
recommended: but I can give it a pass. It's not easy (In terms of it being reflected in the engine. If Football Manager can struggle
hoursPlayed:
then why not this?) and... I guess it has to be portable and multiplatform.
~ It's not exactly the most realistic thing in the world. Mostly comparable to FM Mobile. Expect some crazy moves... but it can add in the flavor.

Negative:
- Somehow the game does not look as well at 1366x768 than in 2015. For instance
voteText: I have to scroll down in the tactics screen to see the entire pitch.\n- There are several interface issues that were not fixed from 2015. Several "intuitive" actions that cannot be done. For instance
helpfulPercent: you cannot pick players from the squad screen
votesHelpful: and you cannot sort players by star rating in the tactics screen. There are others
votesTotal: but I want to keep this short: The number of clicks that are necessary to perform an action should be reduced. And add some kind of indicator for hyperlinks in news posts.\n- Some leagues have the wrong format. For instance
votesFunny: Argentina uses 20 teams and no average point system instead of 30 and average points.\n- The Copa Sudamericana does not exist
commentsCount:
and the Libertadores uses the same format as the Sudamericana.
- The translations are a loooooong way to go.

tl;dr What I said at first - good if you cannot have FM. Stay away otherwise. The story *could* be different on mobile platforms

reviewText: I play the offline game. The game is addictive, but you cannot improve your finance in it. The only way to improve the finance is selling players. I got season 9 and won all the cups and the stadium didn't get half full. The support from fans and the club managment fixed at %50. So this part of the game is disappointing. If you like to manage a small team and go higher, this game will not do it.

reviewText:
This game actually suprised me with how good and fun it is. For a FREE football manager game it is excellent.

This will obviously be compared to Football manager and in my opinion, I prefer this game. I find it to be far less complicated than football manager and and for me is more addictive. I have played with one club my entire time and it really is a blast.

The only problems with the game is microtransactions, which I understand why they are in the game, as it is free. I however have not bought any of the coins and have had no need to. If you however want to have two saves for example you will need about 1000 of these coins. Another problem is with all the pathetic backpasses that lead you to concead absolutely stupid goals and is really frustrating to watch.

Overall I would definately reccommend this game to anyone who is a fan of the beautiful game.
